item.text: These were the nations the Lord permitted to remain so he could use them to test Israel—he wanted to test all those who had not experienced battle against the Canaanites.

He left those nations <st data-num="07535" class="">simply</st> <st data-num="04616" class="">because</st> he wanted to <st data-num="03925" class="">teach</st> the subsequent <st data-num="01755" class="">generations</st> of <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>, <st data-num="07535 0834">who</st> had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">experienced</st> the <st data-num="06440" class="">earlier</st> battles, <st data-num="01847" class="">how to conduct</st> holy <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st>.<n id="1" />

These were the nations:<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="05633" class="">lords</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st>, the <st data-num="06722" class="">Sidonians</st>, and the <st data-num="02340" class="">Hivites</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> in <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st>, from <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="01179" class="">Baal Hermon</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">Lebo</st> <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>.<n id="2" />
They were left to test Israel, so the Lord would know if his people would obey the commands he gave their ancestors through Moses.
The Israelites lived among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.
They took the Canaanites’ daughters as wives and gave their daughters to the Canaanites; they worshiped their gods as well.
The Israelites did evil in the Lord’s sight. They forgot the Lord their God and worshiped the Baals and the Asherahs.
The Lord was furious with Israel and turned them over to King Cushan Rishathaim of Armon Haraim. They were Cushan Rishathaim’s subjects for eight years.
When the Israelites cried out for help to the Lord, he raised up a deliverer for the Israelites who rescued them. His name was Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.
The Lord’s Spirit empowered him and he led Israel. When he went to do battle, the Lord handed over to him King Cushan Rishathaim of Armon, and Othniel overpowered him.
The land had rest for 40 years; then Othniel son of Kenaz died.
The Israelites again did evil in the Lord’s sight. The Lord gave King Eglon of Moab control over Israel because they had done evil in the Lord’s sight.

Eglon <st data-num="0622 0413">formed alliances</st> with<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> and <st data-num="06002" class="">Amalekites</st>. He <st data-num="01980" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, and they <st data-num="03423" class="">seized</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> of <st data-num="08558" class="">date palm trees</st>.<n id="2" />
The Israelites were subject to King Eglon of Moab for 18 years.

When the Israelites cried out for help to the Lord, he raised up a deliverer for them. His name was Ehud son of Gera the Benjaminite, a left-handed man. The Israelites sent him to King Eglon of Moab with their tribute payment.

<st data-num="0164" class="">Ehud</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> himself a <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st>—it had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06366" class="">edges</st> and was <st data-num="01574" class="">18 inches</st> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="02296" class="">strapped</st> it <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> his <st data-num="04055" class="">coat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> <st data-num="03409" class="">thigh</st>.
He brought the tribute payment to King Eglon of Moab. (Now Eglon was a very fat man.)
After Ehud brought the tribute payment, he dismissed the people who had carried it.

But <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">went back</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">once he reached</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="06456" class="">carved images</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0834 0854">at</st> <st data-num="01537" class="">Gilgal</st>. He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to Eglon,<n id="4" /> “I have a <st data-num="05643" class="">secret</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">for</st> you, O <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.” Eglon<n id="5" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02013" class="">Be quiet</st>!”<n id="6" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> his <st data-num="05975 05921">attendants</st> <st data-num="03318 05921">left</st>.

When <st data-num="0164" class="">Ehud</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">approached</st> him, <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="03427" class="">sitting</st> in his <st data-num="04747" class="">well-ventilated</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05944" class="">upper room</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">all</st> by <st data-num="0905" class="">himself</st>. <st data-num="0164" class="">Ehud</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “I have a <st data-num="01697" class="">message</st> from <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">for</st> you.” When Eglon <st data-num="06965" class="">rose up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="03678" class="">seat</st>,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0164" class="">Ehud</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">reached</st> with his <st data-num="08040" class="">left</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="03947" class="">pulled</st> the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> <st data-num="03409" class="">thigh</st>, and <st data-num="08628" class="">drove</st> it into Eglon’s<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0990" class="">belly</st>.

The <st data-num="05325" class="">handle</st> <st data-num="0935 01571">went in</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> the <st data-num="03851" class="">blade</st>, and the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05462" class="">closed</st> <st data-num="01157" class="">around</st> the <st data-num="03851" class="">blade</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> Ehud<n id="1" /> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08025" class="">pull</st> the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> <st data-num="08025" class="">out</st> of his <st data-num="0990">belly</st>.<n id="2" />
As Ehud went out into the vestibule, he closed the doors of the upper room behind him and locked them.
When Ehud had left, Eglon’s servants came and saw the locked doors of the upper room. They said, “He must be relieving himself in the well-ventilated inner room.”

They <st data-num="02342" class="">waited</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">so long</st> they were <st data-num="0954" class="">embarrassed</st>, but he <st data-num="02009" class="">still</st> did <st data-num="0369" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06605" class="">open</st> the <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> of the <st data-num="05944" class="">upper room</st>. Finally they <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="04668" class="">key</st> and <st data-num="06605" class="">opened</st> the doors.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">Right before</st> their <st data-num="02009" class="">eyes</st> was their <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>, <st data-num="05307" class="">sprawled out</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st> on the <st data-num="0776" class="">floor</st>!<n id="2" />
Now Ehud had escaped while they were delaying. When he passed the carved images, he escaped to Seirah.
When he reached Seirah, he blew a trumpet in the Ephraimite hill country. The Israelites went down with him from the hill country, with Ehud in the lead.
He said to them, “Follow me, for the Lord is about to defeat your enemies, the Moabites!” They followed him, captured the fords of the Jordan River opposite Moab, and did not let anyone cross.

<st data-num="01931" class="">That</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">day</st> they <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> about <st data-num="06235 0505" class="">10,000</st> <st data-num="04124 0376">Moabites</st><n id="1" />—<st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="08082" class="">strong</st>, <st data-num="02428" class="">capable</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">warriors</st>; <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> <st data-num="04422" class="">escaped</st>.
Israel humiliated Moab that day, and the land had rest for 80 years.
After Ehud came Shamgar son of Anath. He killed 600 Philistines with an oxgoad. So he also delivered Israel.
